summary: dsRNA genome encodes ten viral proteins (VP), including seven structural proteins (VP1-7) and three non-structural (NS) proteins, NS1, NS2 and NS3 [1], [2], [3]. as a member of arboviruses, BTV is transmitted by certain species of Culicoides biting midges, including C. variipennis and C. imocola [4], [5]. the 1998–2001 outbreak of BTV-8 in the Mediterranean Basin is the greatest epizootic of the disease on record. in 2006, BTV-8 has reached three northern Europe countries, including the Netherlands, Belgium, and Germany [28], [29], and further spread to surrounding countries, reaching Switzerland by the end of October 2007 [6], [30], [31], [32]. results from the previous studies [34], we selected and evaluated the virostatic efficacy of a cluster of active compounds. we selected 2–4 representative compounds from each cluster and assessed their virostatic efficacies against BTV. the EC50 of these lead compounds were determined between 0.7 M and 20 M, respectively (results not shown). virostatic efficacy and cytotoxicity were shown in (A) C003 and (B) C001. cell viability (triangles) or cytotoxicity (circles) was measured using the CellTiter-Glo reagent. each data point represents means and standard deviation from five replicates. our approach to C052 (IC2a) and C055 (IC3a) involved a convergent pathway whereby (1) the Gewald reaction was employed for the thiophene unit (IC4 of zone 1). (2) a Horner-Wadsworth-Emmons reaction of 2-thiophenecarboxaldehyde (IC5) and 2-pyridinecarboxaldehyde (IC6) with malonic acid provided a means to IC7 and cell viability (triangles) or cytotoxicity (circles) was determined using CellTiter-Glo reagent. each data point represents means and SD from five replicates. cell viability assay determines number of viable cells in culture. BTV-induced CPE was prevented after cells were treated with C003 or C052. cells formed a monolayer with no cells detached from the plates. at 72 h.p.i., BTV infected cells showed CPE/apoptosis. caspase-3/7 activity was 3.3-fold reduced at 48 h.p.i. inhibitions of caspase-3/7 activity were similar to inhibition of C003 at similar concentrations. compared with caspase-3/7 activity in cells infected with BTV without C003 treatment. at 24 h.p.i., there were one log differences of virus progeny production in cells treated with C003 or C052 at 10.0 M and 2.5 M respectively. there were three- or two-log reductions of progeny virus production in samples collected at 48 h.p.i. and 72 h.p.i. after treated with C003 or C052. the effects of C003 and C052 on the BTV plaque reduction were in a dose-dependent fashion. at 72 h.p.i., a one-log reduction of plaque formation was observed. when applied at higher concentrations, i.e. 20.0 M of C003 or C052, more than two-log of plaque reductions were observed. both compounds showed no protection to BSR cells from BTV-induced CPE. when added at 32 h.p.i., both C003 and C052 showed similar protection in term of the percentage of viable cells. effects of C003 and C052 on BTV viral genomic RNA replication in infected cells. samples were collected post BTV infection and divided into cells and supernatants portion at different time in the initial 24 h.p.i.. supernatant samples collected at 24 h.p.i from BTV infected. there were 6.17106 copies of BTV viral genomic RNA. there were only 4.81104 or 4.22104 copies of BTV viral genomic RNA. this result indicated a pronounced effect of these virostatic agents at the late stage of viral life-cycle. VP6 is an integral part of a transcription complex essential for primary replication [14]. at MOI of 0.01, VP6 was not detectable at 24 h.p.i. in all samples, but was detected at 48 h.p.i. in BTV-infected cells without C003/C052 treatment. this result supported previous observations that C003/C052 reduced viral protein expression when infected at low MOI of 0.01. the turnover of microtubule-associated protein light chain 3-I (LC3-I) to LC3-II is the only biomarker that is reliably associated with the formation of autophagosome. this is related to virus replication and the leading indicator of virus-induced apoptosis. lead virostatic agents against BTV Based on the previously identified six compound clusters [34], we selected 2–4 representative compounds from each LC3-II in BTV-infected cells without C003/C052 treatment. this result suggested that C003/C052 might act on interfering with BTV induced autophagy, consequently inhibiting BTV-induced CPE. the aminothiophenecarboxylic acid derivative–C003 was identified as a novel compound against BTV. it is plausible that the aminothiophenecarboxylic acid derivative–C003 was identified as a novel compound against BTV, with potent virostatic efficacy, low cytotoxicity and high SI. this leads to an improved virostatic compound–C052 via de novo synthesis. the inhibition of caspsse-3/7 activation indicated the targets should be in the upstream of the cascade of caspase activation. however, when BSR cells were treated with pan-caspase inhibitor, cells were not protected from BTV-induced apoptosis. this suggests that while apoptosis/CPE was inhibited by C003/C052, the mechanism of action of these virostatic compounds might not directly related to BTV-induced apop a growing list of viruses has been translation and replication of dengue virus-2. autophagosomes act as a site for translation and replication of dengue virus-2. autophagy proteins enhance viral replication and progeny virus yields. virostatics targeting virus egress would be predicted to prevent or slow down virus release and spread in an infected host. further studies may be needed to define the exact mechanism of action for
